channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Tree branches need to be cut around tree base blocking access to pavement, 15th January
item.description:
Tree branches need to be cut around the tree base on the junction between Goodrich Road and Barry Road, where the zebra crossing is located. This causes the tree roots to overgrow and creates a trip hazard to access around the pavement. Please, could the branches be cut right back as the pavement is narrow.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 67, Goodrich Road, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing paving slabs around tree roots Barry Road, 15th January
item.description:
Missing paving slabs around tree roots on the junction between Goodrich Road and Barry Road, where the zebra crossing is located, causing the tree roots to overgrow and creating a trip hazard to access around the pavement. Please, could it be cemented over or filled in.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 67, Goodrich Road, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 105 Fordwych Road, 15th January

item.title: Dumped, 15th January
item.description:
This Cul De Sac has only a few parking spots for the residents who live here and this car isn’t one of them. Myself and my neighbours who are disabled and have kids have to park on the road for people like this who dump their car here

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Alnwick Road, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned motorbike, 15th January
item.description:
I opened an abandoned motorbike report and it has been unpolitely closed without any explanation. Given that this is the means stablished by the council to report this type of issues, would it be too much to ask for an explanation whatever it may be?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St Katherines Road, Lower Belvedere, Greater London

item.title: 2 large pot holes., 15th January
item.description:
2 very large pot holes just past the junction of Upperton Road and Chislehurst Road. Anytime a bus or large vehicle, lorry’s etc go through it, out flat (The Elms on the corner of Upperton) shakes and I am starting to worry about it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chislehurst Road, Longlands, Sidcup, Greater London
